name: Emmanouil Zampetakis
content: Manolis Zampetakis Manolis Zampetakis Welcome! I am currently an assistant professor of Computer Science at Yale University. Before Yale, I was a postdoc at the EECS Department of UC Berkeley working with Michael Jordan. I received my PhD from the EECS Department at MIT where I was very fortunate to be advised by Constantinos Daskalakis. For my thesis, I was awared the ACM SIGEcom Doctoral Dissertation Award. In fall 2018, I received the Google PhD Fellowship. I completed my undergraduate studies at NTUA where I was fortunate to work with Dimitris Fotakis. My research interests include: Theoretical Machine Learning, Statistics, Optimization, Computational Complexity, Game Theory, Mechanism Design. Email: manolis.zampetakis [at) yale(dot]edu Students Anay Mehrotra (co-advised with Amin Karbasi) Jane Lee (co-advised with Andre Wibisono) Vikram Kher Katerina Mamali (co-advised with Yang Cai) Shuchen Li (co-advised with Ilias Zadik) Nikolaos Koumpis (co-advised with Leandros Tassiulas) Under Preparation Learning with Positive and Imperfect Unlabeled Data with Jane H.
